content.text:
# 2019 ICC Awards

| award1_type  = Cricketer of the Year
| award1_winner= '''Men's:   Ben StokesWomen's: '''  Ellyse Perry
| award2_type  = Men's Test Player of the Year
| award2_winner=  Pat Cummins
| award3_type  = ODI Player of the Year
| award3_winner= '''Men's:   Rohit SharmaWomen's: ''' Ellyse Perry
| award4_type  = Women's T20I Player of the Year
| award4_winner =  Alyssa Healy
| award5_type  = Emerging Player of the Year
| award5_winner= '''Men's:   Marnus LabuschagneWomen's:  Chanida Sutthiruang
| previous     = 2018
| main         = ICC Awards
| next         = 2021
}}
The 2019 ICC Awards''' were the sixteenth edition of ICC Awards. The voting panel took into account players' performance between 1 January 2019 and 31 December 2019. The announcement of the ICC World XI Teams, along with the winners of the men's individual ICC awards, was made on 15 January 2020. The women's awards were announced on 17 December 2019, with Ellyse Perry winning the Rachael Heyhoe Flint Award as the Women's Cricketer of the Year.

Other awards
{|class="wikitable"
| valign="top" width="50%"|
* Richard Illingworth
|-
| valign="top" width="50%"|
* Deepak Chahar, for taking 6/7 from 3.2 overs against Bangladesh at Vidarbha Cricket Association Stadium in Nagpur on 10 November 2019
|-
| valign="top" width="50%"|
* Virat Kohli, for the incident in which he asked fans not to boo Steve Smith of Australia on 9 June 2019
|}
